column2: Customers, Contractors & Suppliers: Is  your product or service designed specifically to address gender needs in a way that competing products or services are not?
column3: Customers, Contractors & Suppliers: In the design of your products or services, has your organization explicitly tested how products or services are used by different genders and designed and tested products with the needs of those different users in mind?
column4: Customers, Contractors & Suppliers: Does your workplace have policies in place to ensure gender bias is eliminated from marketing materials?
column5: Customers, Contractors & Suppliers: Does the organization have a written policy that suppliers are expected to meet regarding gender equity and diversity standards?
column6: Customers, Contractors & Suppliers: Is there a policy to review potential suppliers to confirm alignment with your organization's position on gender equity and diversity?
column7: Customers, Contractors & Suppliers: Does the organization review and discuss compliance with its gender equity policy prior to signing a contract with a supplier?
column8: Customers, Contractors & Suppliers: Does the organization have a written policy regarding gender equity that specifies the gender-related benefits and practices that a contractor or subcontractor must comply with?
column9: Customers, Contractors & Suppliers: Does the organization review and discuss compliance with its gender equity policy prior to signing a contract with a potential contractor or subcontractor?

column4: We don't use marketing per say, but we do offer materials with images that are inclusive of all genders (for example)
We are just starting to track D&I for vendors, etc.
